headline.main: Morning Buzz: Mayor Calls a Banking Bill 'Ridiculous'

docs.abstract: What we're reading in The Times and elsewhere, including articles about a stabbing in a Brooklyn library and a parody video starring Gov. Chris Christie and Mayor Cory A. Booker.
docs.snippet: What we're reading in The Times and elsewhere, including articles about a stabbing in a Brooklyn library and a parody video starring Gov. Chris Christie and Mayor Cory A. Booker.

headline.main: When a Spending Cut Can Be Like a Tax Increase

docs.abstract: Spending cuts in programs that are means-tested can have a very similar effect to raising taxes. Take Medicare proposals, for instance.
docs.snippet: Spending cuts in programs that are means-tested can have a very similar effect to raising taxes. Take Medicare proposals, for instance.

docs.lead_paragraph: If competitive bidding is predicated on supplying equipment at the lowest possible price, something has to give, and that something is patient care.
docs.snippet: If competitive bidding is predicated on supplying equipment at the lowest possible price, something has to give, and that something is patient care.

headline.main: Campaigns Duel Over Romney's Bain Record

docs.abstract: In rival videos, the Obama and Romney campaigns offer differing views of Mitt Romney's record at Bain Capital.
docs.snippet: In rival videos, the Obama and Romney campaigns offer differing views of Mitt Romney's record at Bain Capital.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former employees of GS Technologies, a Kansas City, Mo., steel mill, appear at their homes, with family photographs and American flags behind them.

headline.main: Obama Ad Focuses on Workers Who Lost Jobs When a Mill Acquired by Bain Capital Closed
headline.print_headline: Obama Ad Focuses on Workers Who Lost Jobs When a Mill Acquired by Bain Capital Closed

docs.abstract: Text and assessment of television ad released by Pres Obama's re-election campaign that will run in Colorado, Iowa, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Virginia, focuses on workers who lost jobs when a Kansas City, Mo, mill acquired by Mitt Romney's company Bain Capital closed.
docs.snippet: Former employees of GS Technologies, a Kansas City, Mo., steel mill, appear at their homes, with family photographs and American flags behind them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney says President Obama has no workable plan to prevent Medicare from going bankrupt, and that he is offering “a dramatic change in perspective and philosophy.”

headline.seo: Romney Medicare Plan Draws Stark Contrast With Obama’s
headline.main: Romney Medicare Plan Draws a Stark Contrast
headline.print_headline: Romney Medicare Plan Draws a Stark Contrast

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney and Pres Obama trade barbs over their contrasting Medicare proposals, each arguing that his opponent's policies would end the popular government-run health insurance program as it now exists; Romney, whose plan calls for limiting the government’s current open-ended financial commitment to Medicare, says that he offers not just a policy change, but a dramatic change in perspective and philosophy.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney says President Obama has no workable plan to prevent Medicare from going bankrupt, and that he is offering “a dramatic change in perspective and philosophy.”
